question: The salinity in parts per thousand (ppt) in oceans, freshwater streams and hypersaline lagoon is ........, ........ and ........ respectively. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The salinity in parts per thousand (ppt) in oceans, freshwater streams and hypersaline lagoon is ........, ........ and ........ respectively. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The salinity (salt concentration measured as parts per thousand) is less than $5$ in inland waters (freshwater), $30-35$ in the sea (oceans), and more than $100$ in some hypersaline lagoons.

question: When two related populations occupy geographically or spatially separate areas, they are called
question_latex: When two related populations occupy geographically or spatially separate areas, they are called
solution: Allopatric populations are those that are geographically separated from each other, often leading to speciation due to reproductive isolation.

question: For weakly motile organisms the immediate surrounding is called [2022]
question_latex: For weakly motile organisms the immediate surrounding is called [2022]
solution: A microhabitat refers to the immediate, small-scale environment of an organism, which is especially relevant for sedentary or weakly motile species.

question: The interaction observed in this diagram is [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: The interaction observed in this diagram is [MHT-CET 2016]
solution: The diagram represents a predator-prey relationship, which is a classic example of predation where one organism (the predator) feeds on another (the prey).

question: Which one of the following statements is INCORRECT with respect to their habitat? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which one of the following statements is INCORRECT with respect to their habitat? [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Many species of small plants growing on forest floor perform photosynthesis.
B. Snow leopards are not found in Kerala.
C. Mango trees cannot grow naturally in Germany.
D. Archaebacteria cannot grow in hot springs.
answer: D. Archaebacteria cannot grow in hot springs.
solution: Archaebacteria are well-known extremophiles that thrive in extreme environments, including hot springs and deep-sea hydrothermal vents.

question: If non-limiting conditions are provided then what will happen?
question_latex: If non-limiting conditions are provided then what will happen?
options: A. Natality increases and mortality decreases
answer: A. Natality increases and mortality decreases
solution: Under non-limiting conditions (unlimited resources), the birth rate (natality) typically reaches its maximum while the death rate (mortality) is minimized, leading to exponential population growth.

question:
Match the water bodies given in Column I with their salinity in Column II. [2022]
Column I: (A) River, (B) Sea, (C) Some Lagoons
Column II: (I) 100 ppt, (II) 5 ppt, (III) 30-35 ppt
question_latex: Match the water bodies given in Column I with their salinity in Column II. [2022] \\ \textbf{Column I}: (A) River, (B) Sea, (C) Some Lagoons \\ \textbf{Column II}: (I) $100$ ppt, (II) $5$ ppt, (III) $30-35$ ppt
options: A. A- II, B - III, C-I
C. A - III, B-II, C - I
answer: A. A- II, B - III, C-I
solution: Rivers have low salinity ($<5$ ppt), the sea has standard salinity ($30-35$ ppt), and hypersaline lagoons can exceed $100$ ppt.

question: Which one of the following is NOT an adaptation found in endoparasites? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT an adaptation found in endoparasites? [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Loss of unnecessary sense organs.
solution: Endoparasites actually have highly developed and complex reproductive systems to ensure the survival and transmission of offspring to new hosts.

question: Statement I: The Monarch butterfly is highly distasteful to its predator bird because of a special chemical in the body. Statement II: The caterpillar of this butterfly feeds on poisonous weed. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Statement I: The Monarch butterfly is highly distasteful to its predator bird because of a special chemical in the body. Statement II: The caterpillar of this butterfly feeds on poisonous weed. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect.
B. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
C. Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct.
D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
answer: D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
solution: The Monarch butterfly acquires cardiac glycosides during its larval stage by feeding on milkweed, which makes the adult butterfly toxic and distasteful to predators.

question: Geometric representation of age structure is characteristic of
question_latex: Geometric representation of age structure is characteristic of
solution: Age structure pyramids are graphical representations that show the distribution of various age groups in a specific population.

question: Barnacles growing on the back of whale is an example for
question_latex: Barnacles growing on the back of whale is an example for
solution: In this interaction, the barnacles benefit from transport and nutrient access, while the whale is neither helped nor significantly harmed.

question: Natality of a region is assessed by rate of ........ per unit area, per unit time. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Natality of a region is assessed by rate of ........ per unit area, per unit time. [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Natality refers to the number of births in a population over a specific period, serving as a key factor in population growth.

question: The soil with poorest water holding capacity is
question_latex: The soil with poorest water holding capacity is
solution: Sandy soil has large particles and large pore spaces, which allow water to drain quickly, leading to poor water retention.

question: Lichens showing relationship between alga and fungus is an example of [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Lichens showing relationship between alga and fungus is an example of [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Lichens are a symbiotic association where the fungus provides structure and protection, while the alga (or cyanobacterium) provides food through photosynthesis.

question: Match types of niche: (a) Habitat, (b) Hypervolume, (c) Fundamental, (d) Realized. II: (I) Absence of competitors, (II) Physical space occupied, (III) Presence of competitors, (IV) Considers biotic and abiotic factors. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match types of niche: (a) Habitat, (b) Hypervolume, (c) Fundamental, (d) Realized. II: (I) Absence of competitors, (II) Physical space occupied, (III) Presence of competitors, (IV) Considers biotic and abiotic factors. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Habitat niche is the physical space (II); Hypervolume considers all factors (IV); Fundamental is the potential niche (III? wait, check source... actually source says C).

question: The formula of growth rate for population in a given time is
question_latex: The formula of growth rate for population in a given time is
solution: The differential equation for exponential population growth is $\frac{dN}{dt} = rN$, where $r$ is the intrinsic rate of natural increase.

question: Percolation and water holding capacity of soil is determined by [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Percolation and water holding capacity of soil is determined by [MHT-CET 2024]
options: D. soil composition and grain size
answer: D. soil composition and grain size
solution: Soil properties like particle size, mineral composition, and aggregation (grain size) determine how water moves through it and how much it can hold.

question: What is a keystone species?
question_latex: What is a keystone species?
options: A. A species which adds upto only a small proportion of the total biomass of a community, yet has a huge impact on organization.
B. A common species that has plenty of biomass, yet has a fairly low impact.
C. A rare species that has minimal impact on the biomass and on other species.
D. A dominant species that constitutes a large proportion of the biomass.
answer: A. A species which adds upto only a small proportion of the total biomass of a community, yet has a huge impact on organization.
solution: A keystone species has a disproportionately large effect on its environment relative to its abundance.

question: Match adaptations: (a) Thick cuticle, (b) Spines, (c) Burrowing, (d) Hot springs. II: (i) Desert lizards, (ii) Archaebacteria, (iii) Desert plants, (iv) Opuntia. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Match adaptations: (a) Thick cuticle, (b) Spines, (c) Burrowing, (d) Hot springs. II: (i) Desert lizards, (ii) Archaebacteria, (iii) Desert plants, (iv) Opuntia. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Desert plants have thick cuticles (a-iii); Opuntia has spines (b-iv); desert lizards burrow (c-i); Archaebacteria live in hot springs (d-ii).

question: A population is a group of all ........ in a given time. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: A population is a group of all ........ in a given time. [MHT-CET 2020]
options: C. Individuals belonging to same species
answer: C. Individuals belonging to same species
solution: A population consists of a group of individuals of the same species living in a specific geographical area and potentially interbreeding.

question: Which one of the following is NOT an important role of predator? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT an important role of predator? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Reduces intensity of competition among prey species.
B. Maintaining species diversity in a community.
C. Acts as vector for prey.
D. To keep prey population under control.
answer: C. Acts as vector for prey.
solution: Predators do not act as vectors for prey; vectors typically refer to organisms that transmit pathogens.

question: If in a population of size N, the birth rates are represented as b and death rates as d, then the increase or decrease in N during a unit time period t will be :
question_latex: If in a population of size $N$, the birth rates are represented as $b$ and death rates as $d$, then the increase or decrease in $N$ during a unit time period $t$ will be :
solution: The net growth rate is the difference between per capita birth rate and death rate multiplied by the population size.

question: Which one of the following is an example of predation? [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Which one of the following is an example of predation? [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The tiger hunts and kills the deer for food, which is a direct interaction of predation.

question: The sequential levels with increasing complexity of an ecological organization are [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The sequential levels with increasing complexity of an ecological organization are [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The hierarchy of biological organization in ecology is Organism -> Population -> Community -> Ecosystem -> Biome -> Biosphere.

question: Which one of the following is not a characteristic of population? [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Which one of the following is not a characteristic of population? [MHT-CET 2021]
options: D. Transfer of energy from one form to another
answer: D. Transfer of energy from one form to another
solution: Energy transfer is a characteristic of an ecosystem or community food web, not of a single population.

question: Humus layer in soil composed of dead fresh organic matter called
question_latex: Humus layer in soil composed of dead fresh organic matter called
solution: Litter consists of recently fallen leaves and organic debris that have not yet begun significant decomposition.

question: Plants growing on sand and gravel are called
question_latex: Plants growing on sand and gravel are called
solution: Psammophytes are plants that are adapted to grow in sandy conditions.

question: Which of the following supports a dense population of plankton and littoral vegetation?
question_latex: Which of the following supports a dense population of plankton and littoral vegetation?
solution: Eutrophic water bodies are rich in nutrients, which promotes heavy growth of algae and other plants.

question: NEERI is [MHT CET 2007]
question_latex: NEERI is [MHT CET 2007]
options: A. National Ethological and Ecological Research Institute
B. National Eugenics and Ecological Research Institute
C. National Ecological and environment Research Institute
D. National Environmental Engineering Research Institute
answer: D. National Environmental Engineering Research Institute
solution: NEERI is located in Nagpur and focuses on environmental science and engineering research.

question: Certain characteristic demographic features of developing countries are
question_latex: Certain characteristic demographic features of developing countries are
options: A. High fertility, low mortality rate, rapid population growth and a very young age distribution.
B. High fertility, high density, rapidly rising mortality rate.
C. High infant mortality, low fertility.
D. High mortality, high density, uneven population growth.
answer: A. High fertility, low mortality rate, rapid population growth and a very young age distribution.
solution: Developing countries typically have expanding populations with high birth rates and improved survival rates.

question: Plants growing in dry and saline soil are called
question_latex: Plants growing in dry and saline soil are called
solution: Halophytes are plants adapted to survive in soils with high salt concentrations.

question: For weakly motile organisms, the immediate surrounding is called [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: For weakly motile organisms, the immediate surrounding is called [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Microhabitat refers to the specific, localized environment that an organism interacts with.

question: The increase in density of a population depends upon [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: The increase in density of a population depends upon [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Both high birth rates (natality) and immigration contribute to an increase in population density.

question: In which regions of the world are hot deserts located?
question_latex: In which regions of the world are hot deserts located?
options: A. Equator and Tropic of cancer
B. Equator and tropic of Capricorn
D. Tropic of cancer and Tropic of Capricorn
answer: D. Tropic of cancer and Tropic of Capricorn
solution: Most major hot deserts are located near the $30^{\circ}$ north and south latitudes.

question: Sigmoid growth curve is represented by
question_latex: Sigmoid growth curve is represented by
options: C. $N_t = N_0 + B + I - D - K$
solution: The logistic growth model, which results in a sigmoid curve, is represented by $\frac{dN}{dt} = rN\left(\frac{K - N}{K}\right)$.

question: Which of the following in INCORRECT about conformers? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following in INCORRECT about conformers? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. They cannot maintain a constant internal environment.
B. When aquatic, they change osmotic concentration of body fluids.
C. Their body temperature changes with ambient temperature.
D. They perform physiological changes to ensure constant body temperature.
answer: D. They perform physiological changes to ensure constant body temperature.
solution: Conformers simply match their internal conditions to the environment; regulators are the ones that perform active physiological maintenance of homeostasis.

question: How many statements are correct about niche? I. Functional role. II. Energy flow. III. Vacant niche filled by others. IV. Same niche shared by multiple species. V. Different niches in same habitat. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: How many statements are correct about niche? I. Functional role. II. Energy flow. III. Vacant niche filled by others. IV. Same niche shared by multiple species. V. Different niches in same habitat. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. I, II, III and IV only
B. I, II and III only
C. III, IV and V only
D. I, II, III and V only
answer: D. I, II, III and V only
solution: Statement IV is incorrect because the Gause's Principle states that no two species can occupy the same niche indefinitely.

question: The niche of a population is defined as
question_latex: The niche of a population is defined as
options: A. Set of condition that interacts
C. Set of conditions and resources it uses
D. Geographical area that it covers
answer: C. Set of conditions and resources it uses
solution: A niche describes how an organism fits into its ecosystem, including its habitat, role, and use of resources.

question: Which of the following statements correctly correlates with the diagrams? [MHT-CET 2014]
question_latex: Which of the following statements correctly correlates with the diagrams? [MHT-CET 2014]
options: A. a and b are steady population
B. a and d are declining population
C. c and d are growing population
D. b and d are declining population
answer: B. a and d are declining population
solution: In age structure diagrams, a base narrower than the middle indicates a declining population.

question: Rat shows presence of strong and stout forelimbs for digging, it is ........ type of adaptation. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Rat shows presence of strong and stout forelimbs for digging, it is ........ type of adaptation. [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Fossorial adaptations are modifications for digging and living underground.

question: Which of the following are euryhaline organisms? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which of the following are euryhaline organisms? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Euryhaline organisms can tolerate a wide range of salinities.

question: Plants growing on saline soils with high concentration of $NaCl_{2}$, $MgSO_{4}$ and $MgCl_{2}$ are called
question_latex: Plants growing on saline soils with high concentration of $NaCl_{2}$, $MgSO_{4}$ and $MgCl_{2}$ are called
solution: Halophytes are specialized plants that thrive in high-salinity environments.

question: $A_{0}$ layer is rich in
question_latex: $A_{0}$ layer is rich in
solution: The $A_{0}$ layer (or O horizon) is the top layer of soil, which is rich in organic matter and humus.

question: If a niche is left vacant due to death of an organism, it provides area for another to fill that position. [2022]
question_latex: If a niche is left vacant due to death of an organism, it provides area for another to fill that position. [2022]
solution: A niche is a specific functional role; when vacated, it can be occupied by another individual or species.

question: The physical space occupied by the organism is called its ........ niche. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: The physical space occupied by the organism is called its ........ niche. [MHT-CET 2020]
output_latex: The physical space occupied by the organism is called its spatial or habitat niche.
solution: The spatial niche refers specifically to the physical location or habitat occupied by a species.

question: If in a pond, there were 500 carp fish last year and 1500 new fishes are added. Calculate the birth rate. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: If in a pond, there were $500$ carp fish last year and $1500$ new fishes are added. Calculate the birth rate. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. 3 offsprings per carp per year
B. 6 offsprings per carp per year
C. 5 offsprings per carp per year
D. 4 offsprings per carp per year
answer: A. 3 offsprings per carp per year
solution: Birth rate = Number of births / Initial population = $1500 / 500 = 3$.

question: July 11th is observed as
question_latex: July $11^{th}$ is observed as
solution: July $11^{th}$ is designated as World Population Day to focus attention on the importance of population issues.

question: The immediate surrounding of an organism in the ecosystem is [2022]
question_latex: The immediate surrounding of an organism in the ecosystem is [2022]
solution: Microhabitat is the term for the localized environment immediately around an organism.

question: The above graph indicates ........ which relation to population. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The above graph indicates ........ which relation to population. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: D. Growth curve with limited resources
solution: A J-shaped curve indicates exponential growth under unlimited resource conditions.

question: The population density is denoted by [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The population density is denoted by [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: In ecology, 'N' is the standard symbol used to represent the total number of individuals (density) in a population.

question: How many animals from following are osmoregulators? Sea turtle, Shark, bony fish, elephant, camel, tadpoles. [2022]
question_latex: How many animals from following are osmoregulators? Sea turtle, Shark, bony fish, elephant, camel, tadpoles. [2022]
solution: Most terrestrial mammals and many aquatic vertebrates are osmoregulators.

question: Which of the following organism can ensure constant body temperature and osmotic concentration? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following organism can ensure constant body temperature and osmotic concentration? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Birds and mammals are endothermic regulators capable of maintaining constant internal conditions (homeostasis).

question: Identify the INCORRECT statement regarding mean annual rainfall based on the graph. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the INCORRECT statement regarding mean annual rainfall based on the graph. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. In arctic and alpine tundra it is less than that in forests.
B. In tropical forest it is more than that in temperate forest.
C. In grassland it is less than the tropical forest but more than temperate forest.
D. In desert it is less than 50 cm.
answer: C. In grassland it is less than the tropical forest but more than temperate forest.
solution: According to the biome graph, rainfall in grasslands is typically less than in both tropical and temperate forests.

question: The quantitative and statistical study of human population is [MHT-CET 2016]
question_latex: The quantitative and statistical study of human population is [MHT-CET 2016]
solution: Demography is the scientific study of human populations, including size, structure, and distribution.

question: Which of these is/are considered the major biomes of the world
question_latex: Which of these is/are considered the major biomes of the world
options: B. Tropical rain forest and temperate forest
solution: These are all recognized major terrestrial biomes determined by climate.

question: The closely related morphologically similar sympatric population, but reproductively isolated are
question_latex: The closely related morphologically similar sympatric population, but reproductively isolated are
solution: Sibling species are nearly identical in appearance but do not interbreed.

question: An insect species shows an explosive increase in numbers during rainy season followed by its disappearance. What does this show?
question_latex: An insect species shows an explosive increase in numbers during rainy season followed by its disappearance. What does this show?
options: B. The food plants mature and die
C. Its population growth curve is of J-type
D. The population of its predators increases
answer: C. Its population growth curve is of J-type
solution: J-type growth represents rapid expansion followed by a sudden crash when a limiting factor is reached.

question: Mycorrhiza forms symbiotic association with [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Mycorrhiza forms symbiotic association with [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: Mycorrhizae are mutualistic associations between fungi and the roots of vascular plants.

question: Logistic growth curve has many phases which are respectively:
question_latex: Logistic growth curve has many phases which are respectively:
options: A. Lag phase, acceleration, deceleration, stationary
answer: A. Lag phase, acceleration, deceleration, stationary
solution: The sequence of phases in the Verhulst-Pearl logistic growth curve.

question: Density of population increases when
question_latex: Density of population increases when
solution: Natality (births) and immigration are the two factors that add individuals to a population.

question: Statement I: New births and Immigration increase population density. Statement II: Deaths and emigration lead to decrease. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Statement I: New births and Immigration increase population density. Statement II: Deaths and emigration lead to decrease. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
B. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
C. Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect.
D. Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct.
answer: B. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
solution: These are the fundamental parameters governing population dynamics.

question: Following are adaptations of desert plants EXCEPT [2022]
question_latex: Following are adaptations of desert plants EXCEPT [2022]
options: A. thick cuticle and stomata in deep pits
C. leaves filled with aerenchyma tissue
answer: C. leaves filled with aerenchyma tissue
solution: Aerenchyma is an adaptation for hydrophytes (aquatic plants) to help with buoyancy and gas exchange.

question: The species of plants that play a vital role in controlling the relative abundance of other species are called
question_latex: The species of plants that play a vital role in controlling the relative abundance of other species are called
solution: Keystone species maintain the structure of a biological community.

question: Which one of the following is NOT an example of commensalism? [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT an example of commensalism? [MHT-CET 2018]
options: C. Sea anemone and hermit crab
solution: $Sacculina$ is a genus of barnacles that are parasites on crabs, not commensals.

question: Match biomes with rainfall: (a) Desert, (b) Tropical forest, (c) Tundra, (d) Coniferous. II: (I) 50-250 cm, (II) Less than 50 cm, (III) Less than 150 cm, (IV) 150-450 cm. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match biomes with rainfall: (a) Desert, (b) Tropical forest, (c) Tundra, (d) Coniferous. II: (I) $50-250$ cm, (II) Less than $50$ cm, (III) Less than $150$ cm, (IV) $150-450$ cm. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Deserts ($<50$ cm), Tropical forest ($150-450$ cm), Coniferous ($50-250$ cm), Tundra ($<150$ cm or specifically low).

question: In India, human population is heavily weighed towards younger group due to
question_latex: In India, human population is heavily weighed towards younger group due to
options: A. Short life span and low birth rate
B. Short life span and high birth rate
C. long life span and high birth rate
D. long life span and low birth rate
answer: B. Short life span and high birth rate
solution: A high birth rate results in a larger base of younger individuals in the population pyramid.

question: In an age pyramid, the pre-reproductive age is individuals between... years old. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In an age pyramid, the pre-reproductive age is individuals between... years old. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Demographically, the pre-reproductive stage is typically defined as ages $0$ to $14$.

question: Which among following is NOT example of predator and prey? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which among following is NOT example of predator and prey? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: This is a commensal interaction where the clownfish gets protection.

question: 500 carp fishes initially. Birth rate of 4 per carp per year. Total at end of year? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: $500$ carp fishes initially. Birth rate of $4$ per carp per year. Total at end of year? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Total = Initial + (Rate * Initial) = $500 + (4 * 500) = 500 + 2000 = 2500$.

question: The permanent decrease in population number occurs due to
question_latex: The permanent decrease in population number occurs due to
solution: Mortality is the factor that results in the removal of individuals from the population permanently.

question: Stomatal transpiration takes place during day time EXCEPT in [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Stomatal transpiration takes place during day time EXCEPT in [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Cacti use the CAM pathway, keeping stomata closed during the day to prevent water loss.

question: An organism which can tolerate wide range of temperature is [2022]
question_latex: An organism which can tolerate wide range of temperature is [2022]
solution: Eurythermal organisms are those that can function across a broad temperature spectrum.

question: Which of the following is correct range of latitudes for temperate region?
question_latex: Which of the following is correct range of latitudes for temperate region?
solution: Temperate zones lie between the subtropical and polar regions.

question: One of following is positive interaction in a population. [MHT-CET 2017]
question_latex: One of following is positive interaction in a population. [MHT-CET 2017]
solution: This is a mutualistic relationship where the anemone provides protection and the crab provides mobility and food.

question: In colloquial language, habitat is a postal address while niche is the ........ [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In colloquial language, habitat is a postal address while niche is the ........ [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The analogy compares where an organism lives (habitat) with what it does (niche).

question: Match interaction signs: (a) Mutualism, (b) Commensalism, (c) Parasitism, (d) Amensalism. II: (+ beneficial, - harmful, 0 no effect). [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Match interaction signs: (a) Mutualism, (b) Commensalism, (c) Parasitism, (d) Amensalism. II: (+ beneficial, - harmful, 0 no effect). [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Mutualism (+,+); Commensalism (+,0); Parasitism (+,-); Amensalism (-,0).

question: The ........ fin acts as a hold fast in sucker fish. [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: The ........ fin acts as a hold fast in sucker fish. [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: The dorsal fin is modified into a sucking disc in Remora fish.

question: Sea anemone hosting clown fish is example of [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Sea anemone hosting clown fish is example of [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The anemone provides protection; the fish does not seem to affect the anemone.

question: Property of soil based on the size of its particles is termed
question_latex: Property of soil based on the size of its particles is termed
solution: Soil texture is the classification based on relative proportions of sand, silt, and clay.

question: The growth rate of a population stabilizes after
question_latex: The growth rate of a population stabilizes after
solution: K represents the maximum population size that an environment can sustain.

question: Physical space occupied by organisms represent ........ niche. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Physical space occupied by organisms represent ........ niche. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The spatial niche is defined by the coordinates or area the organism inhabits.

question: Cuckoo laying eggs in the nest of other birds is example of [MHT-CET 2015]
question_latex: Cuckoo laying eggs in the nest of other birds is example of [MHT-CET 2015]
solution: This is a form of parasitism where the parasite relies on the host to raise its young.

question: Exponential growth equation $N_t = N_0 e^{rt}$. What do $N_0$, e, and r refer to? [MHT-CET]
question_latex: Exponential growth equation $N_t = N_0 e^{rt}$. What do $N_0$, $e$, and $r$ refer to? [MHT-CET]
options: A. Population density at time zero, intrinsic rate, base of log.
B. Intrinsic rate, base of log, density at time zero.
C. Population density at time zero, base of natural log, intrinsic rate.
D. Base of log, intrinsic rate, density at time zero.
answer: C. Population density at time zero, base of natural log, intrinsic rate.
solution: Standard parameters for the exponential growth equation.

question: Select CORRECT statement: [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Select CORRECT statement: [MHT-CET 2020]
options: A. Large number of pre-reproductive group is declining.
B. Total number per unit area is natality.
C. People leaving village for city is emigration.
D. Growth rate depends on age structure.
answer: C. People leaving village for city is emigration.
solution: Emigration is the permanent movement of individuals out of a population.

question: The population will be of declining type if [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: The population will be of declining type if [MHT-CET 2020]
options: A. Post-reproductive is smaller than reproductive
B. Pre and post groups are same
C. Pre group is larger than post
D. Post-reproductive age group is largest
answer: D. Post-reproductive age group is largest
solution: A population declines when the reproductive and pre-reproductive classes are smaller than the post-reproductive class.

question: Which one of following pair shows co-evolution? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of following pair shows co-evolution? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Indian crow and Asian koel
C. leopards and Lions in a forest
solution: Pollinators and flowers often evolve specifically in response to each other's traits.

question: Force opposing the ability to reproduce is called
question_latex: Force opposing the ability to reproduce is called
solution: Environmental resistance includes all limiting factors (food, space, predators) that prevent a population from reaching its biotic potential.

question: Interaction showing negative influence on both species is [2022]
question_latex: Interaction showing negative influence on both species is [2022]
solution: Competition is a (-,-) interaction where both participants are adversely affected.

question: The physiological capacity to produce offsprings is called
question_latex: The physiological capacity to produce offsprings is called
solution: Biotic potential is the maximum reproductive capacity under ideal conditions.

question: Density of population decreases when [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Density of population decreases when [MHT-CET 2020]
options: A. Mortality increases and immigration decreases
C. Natality remains constant and immigration increases
answer: A. Mortality increases and immigration decreases
solution: Increased deaths and decreased arrivals lead to a reduction in density.

question: Calotropis plant produces [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Calotropis plant produces [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: $Calotropis$ produces toxic cardiac glycosides as a defense against herbivores.

question: The term used for species in which last individual died is [2022]
question_latex: The term used for species in which last individual died is [2022]
solution: Extinction is the complete disappearance of a species from Earth.

question: Small number of individuals left after disaster to start new population. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Small number of individuals left after disaster to start new population. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The population bottleneck occurs when a population's size is drastically reduced for at least one generation.

question: Root cap is not found in
question_latex: Root cap is not found in
solution: Hydrophytes often lack root caps or have root pockets because they don't need protection while pushing through hard soil.

question: Associated with a mangrove plant? [MHT CET 2004]
question_latex: Associated with a mangrove plant? [MHT CET 2004]
options: B. Minimize water loss and facilitating aeration
C. Reduce transpiration and store water
D. Adapted to absorb nitrogenous matter
answer: B. Minimize water loss and facilitating aeration
solution: Mangroves have pneumatophores for aeration and salt-management adaptations.

question: Changing nature of population is [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Changing nature of population is [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Population dynamics is the study of how and why populations change in size and structure over time.

question: Which one is NOT a characteristic of habitat? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which one is NOT a characteristic of habitat? [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. It is a physical space.
C. It consists of numerous niches.
D. It is affected by temperature, rainfall.
solution: A habitat can be shared by many different species; the niche is the one that is species-specific.

question: Interaction favourable to both, but not obligatory is
question_latex: Interaction favourable to both, but not obligatory is
solution: Proto-cooperation is a facultative (non-obligatory) mutualism.

question: Identify the INCORRECT statements based on graph. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Identify the INCORRECT statements based on graph. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. In deserts, annual rainfall is less than grassland.
B. In tundra, temperature is usually below zero.
C. In tropical forest, rainfall more than temperate, but temp is less.
D. Mean annual rainfall is maximum in tropical forest.
answer: C. In tropical forest, rainfall more than temperate, but temp is less.
solution: Tropical forests have higher rainfall AND higher mean annual temperatures than temperate forests.

question: Match interaction: (a) Brood parasitism, (b) Invasive species, (c) Ectoparasite, (d) Coevolution. II: (I) Humming bird and plants, (II) copepods, (III) Asian koel, (IV) Eicchornia. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match interaction: (a) Brood parasitism, (b) Invasive species, (c) Ectoparasite, (d) Coevolution. II: (I) Humming bird and plants, (II) copepods, (III) Asian koel, (IV) Eicchornia. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Brood parasitism: Koel (a-III); Invasive: Eicchornia (b-IV); Ectoparasite: copepods (c-II); Coevolution: bird and plants (d-I).
